intro: Crotalaria melilotoides, commonly known as the melilot-like crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Crotalaria melilotoides is also known for its potential medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal remedies.
